RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 34900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since January 1 All owed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since December 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOLICE VITA rated a slim lead inside, was met and dueled from the half mile pole, contested even terms at the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over the game challenge of RAISE A SPEIGHTS, who stalked from the three and four paths and challenged three wide into the backstretch, contested even terms from that point and raced two deep on the far turn, dug in gamely through the final furlong but needed a bit more. BURGEE rated close off the rail, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. TOE TAPPIN LUKE raced with the pace two deep, challenged between horses into the backstretch but dropped back at the five sixteenths pole and faded at the rail on the far turn. INDIANA RED raced off the rail and never factored. BLUEBERRY MASH rounded the first two turns in the four and five paths, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded approaching the quarter pole. TIZBIT settled off the early pace about the three path, gave chase from the half mile pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Dolice Vita
ENTRY.OWNER: Taking Risks Stable LLC and Ulman Louis
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 1/2,dueled,rail far turn,determined effort

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dominick J. Juno & Grandview Stable Inc.

ENTRY.NAME: Blueberry Mash
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Each $2,500 To $10,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANNY'S WINKSTER took over while tapering to the inside and was firmly rated to set the pace, dug in to the challenge of BRISTOL CHANNEL and Wesright nearing the half mile pole and recovered the even terms at the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, drifted into the lane but dug in under steady handling and held on well. BRISTOL CHANNEL steadied off the inside flank of Danny's Winkster early then rated close in the two and three paths, challenged into the backstretch and dueled close two deep on the far turn, came inside the drifting winner leaving the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. TAKE AIM rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, then dueled for third past the eighth pole. BODYSLAM settled two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch and rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out entering the stretch but showed little more. WESRIGHT tapered in and stalked two deep, took a slim lead into the backstretch and was coaxed into a duel toward the three eighths pole, gave up the lead past the five sixteenths, dropped back leaving the quarter and flattened at the rail on the far turn. UNKNOWN AGENDA rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the half mile pole but showed little response. LOOKA LOOKA checked of the heels of Bristol Channel early on and was never a factor. ONLY GET'N BETTER saved ground. SUPER DREAMER rounded the first turn about the five path and was never a factor. After reviewing a claim of foul for interference soon after the start, lodged by the rider of Bristol Channel, against the rider of Danny's Winkster, the Stewards disqualified Danny's Winkster to seventh place for initiating a chain reaction which affected both Bristol Channel and Looka Looka.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,duel 3rd past1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Bodyslam
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2d,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,eased out 1/8,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Danny's Winkster
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved inside,rated pace,met 1/2,edge rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Unknown Agenda
ENTRY.OWNER: JBD Ranch LLC and Jones Duane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 1, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not C onsidered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVER COMPROMISE settled in the three path the first turn, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved three wide on the far turn, took the lead approaching the head of the lane and was steadily handled to widen. INSTIGATED stalked two deep, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and dueled to a slim brief lead two deep midway on the far turn, but was met approaching the head of the lane and had to settle for second best. CURLIN'S MALIBU rated close inside, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then eased out toward the top of the stretch and came along for third late yards. ROYAL THUNDER rated a short lead inside, came under pressure nearing the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened stride leaving the turn. MEGA MILLIONS angled to the inside and settled well off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. ELVIRUS broke through prior the break then saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. JUNGLE WARRIOR raced in the five path the first turn, left the turn outside and never factored. CLASSY SOLUTION drifted to the four path into the first turn, gave chase from the half mile pole then faded about the five path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Malibu
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 9/16,rail far turn,along 3rd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Thunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,met rail mid turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Mega Millions
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,well off pace,chased 3/8,flattened rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 36300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ELLIES LIL CASTLE stalked two deep, challenged past the half mile pole and dueled with a slim disadvantage from that point, contested the far turn two deep then dug in under determined handling to edge out SAYYESTOTHELADY in the final yards. The latter moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole and contested the advantage from that point, raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but grudgingly ceded the final yards. MIDNIGHT BRASS stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, drifted outward in the upper stretch but closed the gap in later yards. BAYS CASTLE rounded the first turn about the three path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn then flattened in the lane. WHALE OF A TIME exchanged contact with BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD leaving the gate then stalked from the three path, gave chase into the backstretch but weakened at the rail on the far turn. The latter exchanged contact with Whale Of A Time leaving the gate, raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. EX RATED saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies Lil Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,challenged past 1/2,2d far turn,determined late edge

ENTRY.NAME: Sayyestothelady
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/2,edge rail turn,reluctant yield

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Brass
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,drifted lane,closed gap

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POSITIVE PHIL tapered in and raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead leaving the five eighths pole, came under some pressure past the five sixteenths and rounded the far turn near the rail, was kept alert through the upper stretch then taken in hand later yards. SUBJECT TO CHANGE took the lead early and moved to the inside, was met past the five eighths pole and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn off the rail and settled for second best. CLOSE THE CASE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. MARK DID IT raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little more. RIDICULOUS rounded the opening turn about the three path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but showed little response. BRIGHT DAWN saved ground well off the pace, eased out and gave chase into the backstretch but showed little response. MANOLITO rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened leaving the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Close the Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ridiculous
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead,met past 5/8,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,settled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowanc es).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO chased inside, raced near the rail into the turn, was eased to the three path through the turn, took the lead mid-stretch and drew away later yards. LORD OF CORK contested the pace through the backstretch, took the lead two deep approaching the quarter pole, raced near the rail on the turn, was met toward mid-stretch and held on for second. AREYOUGONNAKISSME engaged in close early chase, rounded the turn about the four path and finished well while gaining on the runner-up. PINNACLE REEF gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. STROLLINGINTHEWIND gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SPARKED A NOTION bore in on the chute then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three and four paths, left the turn outside and showed little more. XCELLENT START chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly down the lane. COLT ROCK contested the early pace inside, was met at the rail approaching the quarter pole and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Sparked a Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in chute,chased,3& 4p turn,outside 1/8,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Little Roo Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,eased 3p turn,up near 1/16,drew away later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Xcellent Start
ENTRY.OWNER: Coleswood Farm, Inc. and Raim, David

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 23000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE FEBRUARY 1, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 1 Allowed 2 lb s. A Race Since December 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET CASTLE rated a short lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady handling to hold on well. ARROWWOOD tapered in through the front stretch and settled at the rail the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced close three wide on the far turn, dueled clear in second toward mid-stretch and finished evenly. MISS WAVE rated close inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and dueled for third. COACH RUBE rounded the first turn in the three and four paths, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn then flattened stride inside the eighth pole. FEEL THE LOVE raced well off the pace and off the rail the first turn, eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little more. LADY MADISON settled back off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn but flattened stride. MY JUBA stalked the early pace from the three and four paths, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE rated close to the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded past the pole. LOVE TO ZOOM steadied off the heels of Arrowwood into the first turn then saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,held well driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stable, LLC. & Ronney Brown

ENTRY.NAME: My Juba
ENTRY.OWNER: Lugamo Racing Stable LLC and J R Sanchez Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Madison
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,eased out,flatten

ENTRY.NAME: Feel the Love
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,eased out,chased 1/2,4p far turn,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 1, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 l bs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CANTAKEITANYMORE saved early ground then bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in under steady handling through the lane and got up the final yards. AUTS REVOLUTION took the lead two deep past the mile marker and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the eighth pole but relented the final yards. MY CANDY BIZ rated close off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened in a later duel for second. ROYAL CRUSADER settled inside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. CHARITABLE VISIT rounded the first two turns about the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. DR. FERBER rounded the first two turns about the five path, entered the backstretch outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. DUNLUCE CAISSLE raced well back saving ground. RESPECT FOR ALL stalked the early pace about the three path then faded leaving the second turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Cantakeitanymore
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,3p far turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: My Candy Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Auts Revolution
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 3/8,rail turn,relented late yrds

ENTRY.NAME: Charitable Visit
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st two turns,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened lane
